conclusion: Vehicle A drives in from the group of blocks on the right and the task is to determine which blocks A will collide with and where it will eventually stop, considering power, collision, and deflection effects.
Vehicle A is positioned on the right-hand side of the image, facing toward a group of blocks clustered in the centre-left of the frame.
Vehicle A enters from the right-hand edge and heads almost straight toward the clustered group in the centre-left of the frame.
The first object in A's path is a small purple cube, located slightly to the left of the direct line of approach.
A brushes the small purple cube, knocking it a few centimetres to the left; the cube’s very small mass hardly slows the car.
Immediately behind the purple cube is a tall yellow cube, which is larger and heavier.
A rams into the tall yellow cube, causing its nose to rise slightly and its speed to drop sharply.
The yellow cube is touching a large blue cube.
The yellow cube bumps into the large blue cube, causing both blocks to slide a short distance but stay together, forming a single broad obstacle.
After this double impact, A has lost most of its momentum, rebounds slightly to the right, rolls a few more centimetres, and comes to rest.
A comes to rest with its nose pointing toward the lower-right corner of the picture, wedged between the displaced purple cube on its left and the blue–yellow pair in front.
Collisions encountered in order are: small purple cube, large yellow cube, and large blue cube (indirectly via the yellow cube).
Final stopping place: A stops just to the right of the blue–yellow pair, slightly angled away from the cluster, with its rear wheels still on the original approach path.
